intro: Trollius pentapetalus, commonly known as the five-petaled globeflower, is a member of the Ranunculaceae family. It is native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia, including parts of China, Kazakhstan, and Russia. The plant is characterized by its bright yellow, globe-shaped flowers with five petals, which bloom in late summer. Its leaves are palmately divided, and the plant typically grows in rocky or alpine soils. Trollius pentapetalus is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens with well-drained soil and full sun.
